paragraphs.text: Welcome to Advance Orthodontics — a Central Missouri practice dedicated to excellent results and a great patient experience. We believe treatment should be high-quality and straightforward, using modern technology and systems that get outstanding results faster while treating every patient like a person, not a number. Our team emphasizes comfort, fewer visits, helpful financing options, and a supportive office environment that makes care easy for families and adults alike.

items.title: Patient First
items.text: We prioritize kindness, clear communication, and a comfortable experience for every patient.

items.title: Damon System
items.text: Damon braces use lighter forces and often mean fewer visits and a more comfortable experience.

items.title: Discreet Options
items.text: Invisalign and clear ceramic options offer removable, nearly invisible treatment for many patients.

items.title: Flexible Financing
items.text: We offer customized payment plans and help navigating insurance so treatment is affordable.

Home.title: Meet Dr. Darren Wittenberger, DDS, MS

paragraphs.text: Dr. Darren Wittenberger is a board-certified orthodontist with a Certificate of Specialization and Master of Science in Orthodontics. He completed dental school at the University of Missouri–Kansas City and specialty training at the University of Iowa. Dr. Wittenberger is committed to continuing education, surgical-orthodontic care, and delivering patient-centered, high-tech treatment.

image.alt: Dr. Darren Wittenberger, orthodontist at Advance Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: We offer a range of modern orthodontic options, from Invisalign to Damon braces, plus retainers and finishing care to protect your results.

og_meta.description: Advance Orthodontics provides modern orthodontic care in Central Missouri with Damon braces, Invisalign, retainers, and flexible financing.

image.alt: Advance Orthodontics office interior with team and patients, bright welcoming reception area

paragraphs.text: We create smiles that people are proud of and love showing off. Our genuine goal is to show patients a very high level of care. We treat our patients like actual humans, not just orthodontic cases, while building trust and respect.
Your happiness is important. We treat our patients with kindness, respect, and humility. We’re concerned with amazing results, but focusing on people is what makes us different.

image.alt: Dr. Darren Wittenberger headshot, smiling in clinical coat

paragraphs.text: Dr. Darren Wittenberger, DDS, MS, is a Columbia, Missouri native who brings years of clinical experience and a patient-first approach to orthodontic care. He is committed to delivering excellent treatment with honesty, respect, and clear communication.
Dr. Wittenberger joined the cleft lip and palate team at the University of Missouri Children’s Hospital and has focused on complex orthodontic needs, including surgical-orthodontic cases.

image.alt: Dr. Darren Wittenberger smiling in office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Wittenberger completed his undergraduate studies at the University of Missouri in Columbia. He earned his Doctor of Dental Surgery degree, with high honors, from the University of Missouri–Kansas City College of Dentistry.
He received his Certificate of Specialization and a Master of Science degree in orthodontics from the University of Iowa, where he trained in surgical-orthodontic approaches.
Dr. Wittenberger completed specialized training in nasoalveolar molding at New York University and became Board Certified by the American Board of Orthodontics in 2007.

Dr. Wittenberger prioritizes continuing education and regularly attends conferences and courses to bring new techniques and technology into the practice. Ongoing learning helps the team deliver modern, efficient care and a better patient experience.

Dr. Wittenberger is a member of the American Association of Orthodontists, the Missouri Society of Orthodontists, the American Dental Association, the Missouri Dental Association, and the Columbia Dental Society.

Dr. Wittenberger and his wife Crystal have five children. He enjoys travel, cooking classes, attending sporting events, playing the drums, and staying active. He roots for the Missouri Tigers, Kansas City teams, and follows local sports with enthusiasm.

“We want to be known for providing truly excellent treatment. We know that people can’t always tell the difference between great orthodontic treatment and just average treatment. We’re serious about quality, honesty, trust, and respect. But even beyond orthodontic treatment, we want patients to feel like we’ve treated them with respect. It’s about treating our patients the way we’d want to be treated.”

paragraphs.text: Every smile begins with an exam. At your first visit we’ll review your dental and medical history, take any needed X-rays, and provide a clear overview of treatment options so you can decide with confidence.
You’ll meet our team, get a personalized treatment plan, and discuss insurance, payment options, and next steps so starting care is simple and transparent.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and will file claims electronically to make your visit easier. Our team will verify benefits and explain what to expect before treatment begins.
Flexible payment plans are available so cost doesn’t stand in the way of care. Talk with our treatment coordinator about options to fit your budget and timeline.
Before your appointment, please complete any new patient forms online or bring printed copies with you. Use the links below to schedule, log in to your patient portal, or manage payments.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online

seo.page_description: Schedule a free consult with Advance Orthodontics. Find locations, patient portal links, payment options, and contact information to get started.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Advance Orthodontics offers the Damon System because it can streamline treatment for many patients, often reducing office visits and improving comfort throughout care.
Damon Clear offers the same efficient, comfortable tooth movement as the traditional system but with brackets that are less noticeable during treatment.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: The metal Damon braces remain a durable, reliable option; they provide efficient tooth movement and are a strong choice for many traditional orthodontic cases.
Insignia is an individualized braces option focused on tailored bracket placement for precise, efficient results when a custom approach is preferred.
Clear ceramic braces offer a less noticeable option for patients who want discreet brackets without compromising effective tooth movement.

image.alt: Orthodontic patient receiving orthognathic surgical consultation

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> uses clear, removable aligners and advanced 3D imaging to move teeth precisely while letting you brush, floss, and eat without bracket restrictions.
At Advance Orthodontics we use Invisalign<sup>®</sup> and Invisalign Teen for many cases where a low-profile, flexible option fits a patient’s lifestyle.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Invisalign Teen uses the same clear-aligner technology with features tailored for adolescents, including compliance indicators and replacement aligners when needed.

image.alt: Young woman smiling and holding an orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: The iTero intraoral scanner captures fast, radiation-free 3D images of your teeth and gums to help us plan treatment with greater precision and comfort.

image.alt: iTero digital scanner in use during orthodontic consultation

paragraphs.text: More About Us Your happiness is important. We treat our patients with kindness, respect, and humility.

accordion.header: How do I know if my child needs orthodontic treatment?

paragraphs.text: It is usually difficult for you to determine if treatment is necessary because there are many problems that can occur even though the front teeth look straight. Also, there are some problems that look intimidating and complex which will resolve on their own. Asking your general dentist is good reference, but we are your best resource since orthodontics is all we do. Our initial exam is complimentary and we would be more than happy to see your child and make any recommendations necessary. Learn more: https://advanceortho.com/common-orthodontic-questions/#how-do-i-know-if-my-child-needs-orthodontic-treatment

Orthodontic treatment has come a long way in recent years. New technology allows us to use lighter forces to move the teeth over a much shorter amount of time. You can expect the braces to make your teeth sore for a few days after they are placed and after each adjustment. These adjustments will make you more conscious of your teeth, but they should not be painful. This annoyance can be relieved with an over-the-counter pain reliever (use as directed). Today’s braces are smaller, more comfortable and use technology that reduces the discomfort. We use the latest in miniature braces and the highest quality of orthodontic materials in order to reduce discomfort and treatment time.
